meanings.definition: To force open (a door, window, etc.) with a crowbar or similar tool.
meanings.sent1: He was jemmying the window open with a crowbar.
meanings.sent2: The burglar was caught jemmying the door of the house.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy thief tried jemmying the door but ended up hitting his own foot.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like jemmying through a wall of obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The sound of jemmying echoed through the empty building.

meanings.definition: The act of using a crowbar or similar tool to break into a locked space.
meanings.sent1: The police found evidence of jemmying at the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: The old lock showed signs of jemmying attempts.
meanings.sent3: The jemmying of the safe was portrayed comically in the movie.
meanings.sent4: The idea of jemmying into the treasure chest excited the young adventurers.
meanings.sent5: The noise of jemmying could be heard from the other side of the wall.
